body:
@caisq are you sure? this is a rather common formulation and I do mean an adaption _relative to x_ (not _adapt_ relatively, but _is_ relative), as e.g. used here:

https://books.google.es/books?id=omIpBgAAQBAJ&pg=PA58&lpg=PA58&dq=%22is+adapted+relative%22&source=bl&ots=q8_AXXgfnX&sig=vxktLNEYCCotiMMREPza-evZn-s&hl=en&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwidlL_C19zbAhUJSsAKHZZwDsMQ6AEINDAC#v=onepage&q=%22is%20adapted%20relative%22&f=false
